storyInfo: In Columbia, Roberta makes funeral arrangements for a friend who unfortunately passed away.

attributes.content: Here we are, Miss Baker. My condolences.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: May I see her?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: She looks peaceful... like she wasn't in too much pain.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: She was in the final stages of her disease, and she insisted further treatment was pointless. Most of the plans the doctors came up with were palliative, and so...
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: So they gave her a lot of suppressants.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: (Wipes tears from eyes)
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: A while ago, she wrote me a letter to tell me she was sick. I was gonna head back as soon as I could to pay her a visit, but I couldn't take time off work.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: When I finally got a few days off and made it to the hospital, her bed was already empty. I asked the nurse, and she gave me this address.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: It's a good thing you came today... If you were just a day later, I'm afraid you wouldn't have been able to see her. According to the schedule, she's going to be cremated tonight.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Right. So I came just in time.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Sorry, I didn't mean it like that...
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: No, I'm not trying to blame you. I'm just lamenting.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Are you okay? I can bring you a chair, if you need it.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: No thanks... Did she leave any personal effects?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Um... We found lots of cosmetics in the apartment she rented. There was also glue, clay, oil paintings, wigs, and some really scary-looking props.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: I guess the room probably looked like a serial killer's hideout.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Right, we cleared out six cans of fake blood from that room... not to mention the fake limbs and eyeballs.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Was there anything else?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Oh, she was holding a notebook when she died.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Can I see it?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Give me a minute. I'll get it for you.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Here. To tell the truth, as someone who works in a morgue, I can say for certain that this is the scariest thing I've ever seen in my entire life.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: (Flips through the pages) ...
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I didn't expect her to hold onto my pictures.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: This scary old woman here... Is that you?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Yeah, we used to practice on each other. The monster with the pustules all over is her.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Hm? Is that a letter?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: 'For Baker.'
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.text: <i>We had a tight deadline and a tight budget. By the time we were in post, both of us were stretched thin. The only thing that wasn

I was thinking of helping out after I got discharged, but the doctors all had such long faces. They insisted on me staying in the hospital. The days here are boring, and that got me reminiscing about the old days. That room in the basement we spent all that time in, the ice cold beers with white foam, and the movies we never got tired of...

attributes.content: I'm really sorry. We were too careless and didn't notice the letter. If we'd found it, we would've contacted you immediately.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: It's okay. The stuff drawn on here is scary. I get how hard it'd be to look over everything.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Still, it's an oversight on our part.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Even if you managed to get in touch with me, it wouldn't have changed anything. I just would've found out she died sooner.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: *sigh*... Once they're dead, they're gone forever. Miss Baker, at the end of the day, you're here. She'll have someone to send her off as she departs on her final journey.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Is there anything I can do?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Nothing. I cleaned her body yesterday, got her out of her hospital gown, and changed her into some proper clothes.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Thanks for that.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I was just doing my job. In a minute, I'll put on some makeup. She'll look much better.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Makeup? Is that something you usually do?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Oh, it's just some broad strokes. There's really nothing that special to it.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Is it okay... if I do it?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Well... Are you sure about that? Knowing who you are...
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: I don't mind, and I just so happen to have all the tools I need on me.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Let me do her makeup one last time, like the old days.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Yeah... I guess I couldn't do it as good as you.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Now that's not true. You're the expert here when it comes to embalming. I'm sure I'll have questions for you later.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Not at all...
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: (Wipes the deceased's face)
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Do you know... how she died?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Chronic poisoning. The doctors think it's because of long-term exposure to cheap, low quality paint. The staff who handled her belongings also complained about how pungent those things all were.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: You don't seem surprised.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: When a low budget production finally gets funded, who'd spend the money on a makeup artist instead of a couple more hot actresses? Of course they'd just keep pinching pennies on every opportunity they got.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: And I warned her about this a long time ago...
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: (Looks up and blinks)
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Never mind. It's all in the past now.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: (Picks up the brush)
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Why did you stop?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: I've never done makeup on the dead. She's here, but she can't say a single word to me. I really don't know how she wanted herself to look in the end.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Actually, when we apply makeup to the dead, we don't always do it the way they'd want. Sometimes, we do it the way their family wants them to look.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Just make her look the way you'd want.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: The way I'd want...?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: That's right. The most beautiful she ever looked in your memories.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: The most beautiful she's looked...
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Hey, Baker! Baker! Something on your mind?
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: Cynthia! I've waited for you for a whole hour! You know that?!
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Sorry, this meal's on me, okay?
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: Where have you been?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I ran into Mario around the corner, so I talked to him for the better part of the day. I got no idea who he ripped off this time, but he came up with the money to start shooting his next picture.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: He never knows when to give up, huh?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: You know, I'm not one to give up, either!
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: I know, but the last couple times you two worked together... really bombed. You know what the stuck-up critics call him? 'Box Office Poison,' 'Wrankwood's Tumor.'
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Hmph, the same people called him 'Father of the Slasher' and 'Master of Horror' fifteen years ago.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: Cynthia, it's time for us both to admit that slasher flicks are out. Mario's time has come and gone.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Do you remember that time we got together in the basement and watched The Vault of Gore together. It's what inspired us to become makeup artists.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: The bizarre, horrifyingly lifelike looks scared us shitless. It wasn't until later we learned it was just latex and oil paint.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: You kept freaking out on the way back home. It was so annoying.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: Look who's talking. You were so freaked out, you couldn't say a single word. You ignored me the whole trip.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Hahahahaha!
attributes.name: Tall Woman and Roberta

attributes.content: Haha... *cough*...
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: (Quickly gives her a cup of water)
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Are you okay, Cynthia?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: *gulp* *gulp*... I'm fine. So anyway, why did you ask me here today, Baker?
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: A crew working on a historical drama came looking for me. They need a makeup artist to help them do up a whole gaggle of Victorian noblewomen. I'm thinking you might be the right girl for the job.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: A Victorian period piece... We're talking elegant eyebrows and extravagant hairstyles? Interesting.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: It's funded by the Victorian government, so the budget's solid. The cast, director, and everyone's the best of the best in the industry. You'll make all kinds of connections.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: They'll see what you can do. And after this job, you won't ever have to worry about getting work again.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Nah... Maybe next time. I already told Mario I'd do his movie.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: Please, Cynthia. Turn Mario down. This is the better opportunity.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Say what you want, disgusting, extreme, but those bloody scenes inspire me.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: You know you sound like a serial killer?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Good idea. Sounds like a fine career.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: I'm not kidding. You need to think about your future.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I know the B-movies I work on have stupid plots full of holes and crude cinematography. I know they're so weird and out-there that audiences ignore them and the critics razz them.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: But I don't care. I think there's nothing more awesome! My movies are brave enough to actually do stuff the mainstream films shy away from. The cookie-cutter blockbusters don't dare to imagine what the B-movies do.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: They're eccentric, weird, absurd, and over-the-top. And that's what freedom means to me, it's what I've always dreamed of.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: But how are we supposed to chase our dreams with no food on the table?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Life is short, Baker. The more you want, the less you actually get. Sometimes, we have to focus on the things that we really want, instead of everything.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: Tell me. Do you really like those pictures you work on? Is that 'refined taste' really worth pouring all your energy and effort into?
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: I... I don't know. It's all just work to me. I just do my job.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: What about all the stuff that you've shelved? When will you go back to that?
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: When I get the chance... I... I'll revisit them.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I can't wait, though!
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: I'll never stop or compromise. I'm gonna do what I love every day, as long as I live, even if it only brings me pain.
attributes.name: Tall Woman

attributes.content: Did you come up with something?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: I just remembered a conversation we had. She said she was going to do what she liked.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: It was a cloudy day. The guy who owned the restaurant was so stingy that he didn't want to turn on a few more lights. It was completely dark, so I shouldn't have been able to see her face all that clearly...
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: But I still vividly remember her smile.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: The face before her, white as a sheet of paper, overlaps with the face full of resolve and hope in Roberta's memories. She picks up her brush and starts painting the lifeless face.
As her brush applies the makeup foundation stroke after stroke, the face starts to become more vibrant, its dried out cheeks looking plump once more.
(Sets down the brush)
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Are you finished?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm done.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: It's like she's only sleeping. You know your stuff.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: You think so?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I've known her since I started in this industry.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Back then, I didn't have a penny to my name, and I couldn't find a place to stay. She took me into her little basement.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: After that, the two of us hopped from production to production, looking for work that could earn us a living.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: She was a first-class makeup artist. She could turn a face into something totally different.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: From the sound of it, she could've made a lot of money in Wrankwood.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: You need more than talent to make it big in Wrankwood. Her luck was rotten to begin with, but she was stubborn, too. She skipped every opportunity that came her way.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Seven years. We knew each other seven years. I remember how much energy she had when she got here, how she slaved away at night working on her projects, how excited she was when she got her first credit, and now...
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Now she's lying here in the morgue.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Ice cold, pale, and lifeless.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: But she looks much better after the makeup you did on her?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: No, this isn't what I wanted...
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Huh... Is it not good enough?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: What do you think...? If really did it right...
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Then why isn't she opening her eyes? Why isn't her heart beating? Why are her lips shut tight...?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Why is she just lying there... in silence?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Well... because she's dead.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Right... She's dead... Gone forever.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: A sense of perplexity spreads from Roberta's face. At a loss, she simply looks at the tall, lifeless body.
With her guard down, the pain in her heart takes its chance to strike. The sharp sensation spreads out to every corner of her body.
At last, she finds herself unable to stand. She squats down into a ball, buries her face into her knees, and cries uncontrollably.
If I was... just a little determined, just a little stubborn, would things have turned out different for her?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: What makes you say that?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: In Wrankwood, two things top the big studios' wishlists. First and foremost, they want people who follow orders. Next, they want technique. Your dreams and interests don't matter.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I know that better than anybody, but I gave up on pushing her. I couldn't do it.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Because... there was a voice in my heart that told me she was right.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: But I decided to ignore it. I couldn't keep going, like she did.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I made it all the way to today. I bowed my head to put food on the table.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I gave up and sacrificed a lot to stay commercial. And so my work became more and more successful.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: At the same time, my stuff got less interesting. I'm sure, one day, I'll be completely sick of it.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: But the excitement and joy she had never died down from the day she started in the business.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I think... with nothing else, that could've pushed her to make a name for herself.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I've always held out hope that her luck would turn around, that she'd be the exception to prove the rule. I really hoped for her... but I was wrong.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Sorry... I'm sorry, Cynthia.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Miss Baker. How... how is any of that your fault?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: (Cries uncontrollably)
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Sorry, I lost my cool.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. People break down in here all the time. You actually kept it together pretty well.
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: Honestly... The moment you sent her into the cremator, the thought of wiping all the makeup off crossed my mind.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: I was thinking, how could I let a peaceful sleeping face define her whole life?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I covered up all her life experience with makeup and forced a peaceful expression onto her... How is that any different from everything I gave up?
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: But you didn't... Why?
attributes.name: Morgue Worker

attributes.content: At the very moment... all of a sudden, I didn't wanna be a makeup artist anymore. I told myself, for just a second, I would become an embalmer who's committed to her work.
attributes.name: Roberta

attributes.content: I wanted to let her leave this world happy, even if it's all fake.
attributes.name: Roberta
